list_definition.definition: a yellow colouring/coloring and flavouring/flavoring substance used in cooking

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We added some saffron to the rice.
Many Buddhist monks wear saffron robes.

list_ex_of_english: They are saffron covered parathas made from a dough of flour mixed with milk and ghee and baked in iron tandoors.
The documentation describes the color as "saffron" but many local observers described it as orange.
There is also a tradition of the bride carrying a glass of kesara dudha (saffron milk) to the bridegroom.
The sutras are chanted in unison by monks in saffron robes.
The chief ingredients are flour, semolina, sugar, molasses soaked in saffron, poppy or nigella seeds, salt, ghee (clarified butter).
He wore robes of saffron and wielded a scimitar in battle.
Influence of the type of dehydration process on the sensory properties of saffron spice.
The priests give a saffron cloth to every pilgrim and an oath is taken that each would help the other.
